Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2008 03:06PM NoH8 wrote: While I agree with you that we can't always trust what people say online, I don't think it's helpful as a community toÂ  play detective and call other people out publically, with or without using names. As a psychologist, i get concerned when people start coining their own disorders and giving them similar names to actual psychiatric illnesses and then arm chair diagnosing someone. There is a real illness called munchausen syndrome by proxy, but internet munchausens something a lay person imagined. So what if someone is making something up. That's just a function of their own psychopathology. I think there is a lot more harm posting suspicions because that can make everyone feel unsafe, distrustful and leery of sharing for fear of not being believed.
Posts.Title: Sorry - I don't buy it ICanDoThis heatherpalmerton
